thread.section_title: Australian Business & World Finance News - Yahoo!7 Finance
thread.title: $A recovers after $US rally

title: $A recovers after $US rally
text:
Fri, Jul 31, 2015, 1:05 PM AEST - Australia Markets close in 2 hrs 55 mins $A recovers after $US rally AAP â€“ 32 minutes ago Print 
The Australian dollar has recovered some ground after earlier being weighed down by expectations of a rate rise in the US. 
At 1200 AEST on Friday, the currency was trading at 72.99 US cents, down from 73.01 cents on Thursday, but well above the six year low of 72.55 US cents hit overnight. 
That low came as the US dollar was boosted by US economic growth figures that support expectations of an interest rate hike later in 2015. 
KEY MOVEMENTS: 
* 72.99 US cents, from 73.01 cents on Thursday 
* 90.55 Japanese yen, from 90.66 yen 
* 66.69 euro cents, from 66.60 euro cents 
* 110.94 New Zealand cents, from 110.22 NZ cents 
* 46.76 British pence, from 46.79 pence 
Government bond yields: 
* CGS 5.5pct Jan 2018, 1.865%, from 1.901% on Thursday 
* CGS 4.25pct April 2026, 2.852%, from 2.930% 
Sydney Futures Exchange prices: 
* Sept 2015 10-year bond futures contract at 97.195 (implying a yield 2.805 per cent), up from 97.120 (2.880 per cent) on Thursday 
* Sept 2015 3-year bond futures contract at 98.080 (1.920 per cent), up from 98.050 (1.950 per cent) 
(*Currency closes taken at 1700 AEST previous local session, bond market closes taken at 1630 AEST previous local session) 
Source: IRESS
